info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:16PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Jones, northern Nolan, northwestern Taylor and Fisher Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mccaulley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Stamford, Anson, Hamlin, Roscoe, Merkel, Roby, Hawley, Lueders, Trent, Sylvester, Noodle, Mccaulley, Avoca, Longworth, Neinda, Nugent, Wastella, Funston and Lake Sweetwater. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 231 and 274. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
